WorkItem.Description:
Tree model is broken in 2.3.1, it seems.
 
Steps to reproduce:
 
Create a new druid tree.
 
In the fight options, drag "Average number of Lifebloom Stacks" from 0 to 1.
 
Now select "Slow build and bloom" or "Fast build and bloom" instead of "Rolling no bloom".
 
Scroll the comparison window to the bottom and observe that caster gear is being shown with negative values of "HealSustained".  Top scoring gear seems to be feral stuff with caster gems in it...
 
I don't think this happened in 2.3.0, although the fight detail setup has changed since then so I can't be sure.
WorkItem.Summary: [Tree] Negative HealSustained values if Lifebloom Blooms

Comments.Message: I bet this is the same bug Trolando (a developer) mentioned in a discussion thread: "Average number of lifebloom stacks - this is currently bugged".  I'll throw a vote at this one :).  (As soon as I figure out how.)
With all the recent changes in the tree model, I'm sure this is fixed.  I certainly haven't been able to reproduce it in 2.3.4.  So, this issue can probably be closed now.
